Mako woke up in a cold sweat. "What a strange dream...", he thought to himself as he wiped the perspiration from his forehead. In his dream, he had shrunken down to roughly the size of a mouse and Korra was simply gigantic, like about the same size as the Aang statue in Republic City. "Thank goodness it was only a dream.", he thought to himself, "I'd hate to be around a giant Korra." He shuddered at the mere thought of a colossal Korra. Considering her generally reckless personality, being around her at normal size tended to be somewhat detrimental to his health. On top of that, her giant clash with Unalaq demonstrated that, despite her being the protector of the world, a giant-sized Korra combined with her inherently impulsive nature could spell disaster to anyone near her. What made Mako even more uncomfortable was the mean attitude she exhibited in his dream. "Perhaps she was still angry over the way they left their relationship after the break-up.", he wondered.

As Mako started to stand up, he began to notice that the place where he awoke was...strange to say the least: He could see nothing but pure abyss, not even his own hands. Yet, when he felt the ground, he started to doubt that this area was his bedroom. The ground here felt...soft like sheep wool (unlike the wooden floorboards in his apartment. Also, a peculiar, faint aroma engulfed the entire atmosphere. He took note of the smell and the humidity of the cavern as he began to advance through the mysterious cavern.

The walls, he noticed, seemed to be made of the same fabric as the ground, and as he moved forward through the cave, it seemed as if the ceiling was...expanding. It was not the only oddity; the cave's fur-like ground began to grow larger as well; whereas it was like grass when Mako awoke, it was now roughly up to his neck...and still growing. Even the foul vinegary stench was growing stronger as he progressed.

"Where am I?", he pondered as he continued forward. Just as he asked that, Mako tripped and tumbled down a long woolen hill. He landed in a small pond that reeked up of stale corn chips. He rose to his knees, lit an ember in his palm and inspected his new surroundings, coughing as the muggy air filled his lungs. From what he surveyed , it appeared that he had fallen into a valley of sorts. He turned around and saw, lurking above him at the peak of the hill, was a creature he had never seen before in his entire life. The beast appeared not to be moving. It was a elephantine mound bearing a hue that could only be described as white with a strong hint of yellow. The snoozing monster emitted the same scent Mako had smelled earlier; however, as he crept closer to it, the odor grew much more potent. He carefully placed his hand on the stationary beast, and felt as moist, salty perspiration leaked from its fur onto his hand. "This place looks like an crater landed here long ago, and now this area has become a swamp of some kind. Judging by its size, this monster must be its guardian or something.", he explained to himself, "I better grab the map an- "

Suddenly the entire world began to shake violently as a seemingly systemic series of tremors emitting from the steps of some unknown behemoth seemed to be approaching Mako's location. The booms propelled his entire body off the ground into the fur of the slumbering. Despite the powerful quivers of each footfall, the monster did not move, he noted. "Perhaps, it's dead.", he whispered. He attempted to crawl of the beast and get into his signature fighting stance...but he could neither keep his balance nor estimate from which the direction the behemoth was approaching. All he knew was that, judging by the sheer force of its footsteps, this monstrosity was immense, much more immense than anything he's ever faced before.

Finally, the quakes ceased...and a sudden feeling of weightlessness lifted Mako's entire world. He quickly grasped the tangles in the monster's fur and held on as a mysterious force lifted the beast up into a blinding beam of light.

***

When the morning sunlight crept through the bamboo blinds into her apartment and hit her drowsy eyelids, Korra jumped out of her bed; she was late for training. Without a moment's thought, she threw on her matted blue sweatpants and undershirt. Her turquoise eyes scanned the room for her sheepskin boots. She spotted one lying next to Naga's bed on its side. She grabbed it and threw it onto her mattress, searching now for its sister. After hastily searching the room for it, she finally noticed the other sitting upright on her dresser. "God, I'm an idiot.", she sighed as she jogged over to the boot.

"Gotta do whatever I can to be late.", she sarcastically remarked to herself as she reached into the confides of the boots, hoping that she left her white socks inside. Surely enough, she felt the worn fabric of the tube socks and pulled them out of the boot. Right as she lifted the socks out of the boot, a subtle fragrance wafted into her nostrils. "Whew!", she remarked, turning her head away from the soiled footwear, "You guys seriously need a wash." Without a second thought, Korra pulled the dingy socks over her muscular calves and rushed over to her boots.

Not being one for proper hygiene, Korra had worn these socks for...well...she lost count about five days ago. "Being the Avatar takes its toll on one's time.", she reasoned. This particular morning was just one of many where she found herself bolting out the door with little disregard (if any) for her appearance and hygiene. Today in particular was going to be an especially busy day: she had probending training in 30 minutes, a meeting in Ba Sing Se at 9:30, more training at noon, and finally, a picnic date in Summer Lotus Woods with Asumi. Korra had no time to lose, especially to worry about something as mundane as the condition of her socks; it was not like anyone was going to smell her feet anyway...

***
The sheer enormity of his friend/former lover sent a shiver down Mako's spine. He had faced countless foes before that had towered over him: the Dark Avatar, Kuvira's Mecha, etc....but this....

He took a deep gulp as a turquoise iris the size of the moon gazed indifferently upon his insignificance. Previously, in his dream (which at this point, he started thinking that it might not have been a dream), he was roughly the size of a mouse (about four inches tall). However, judging by the scale of Korra and her sock relative to him, he estimated his height to be on par with ants. "No", he thought fearfully, "she would notice an ant on her sock...I must be no bigger than a flea for her not to notice me."

He harnessed all of the power he could into his left hand, and with it, launched an meteor-sized conflagration towards Korra. "Hopefully, this will get her atten-"

For a fleeting second, as she was putting on her right sock, she saw a minuscule flash fizzle into the air. Giving him no time to think, Mako held onto the sock as it hurled through the air at an immeasurable speed. As Korra began to pull the sock over her plump toes, Mako lost his grip and tumbled down the expanse of the matted cotton. Her monolithic fingers tugged the fabric over her tan ankle and up to her calf. She wiggled her socked toes as she reached for its sheepskin sheath. Mako, meanwhile, could only hold on as tight as he could to the sweat soaked fibers surrounding the massive toes. Not being able to see the colossal Korra's face and the strong, pungent fragrance of cheesy corn chips indicated to him that he was currently located beneath Korra's toes. Mako's entire world darkened as Korra sheathed her right foot inside its warm, fuzzy home. As the sock made contact with the unkempt sheepskin sole, the fibers began to devour Mako. He felt himself sinking deeper and deeper into Korra's worn, sweaty sock until finally, all but his face and upper torso were consumed by the cotton entity.

Earlier, he had pondered whether or not this sock was a monster; now, he realized that his hypothesis was much more on-the-nose than he thought. His plight only grew worse as he was suddenly met with unfathomable amounts of cotton; Korra scrunched her socked toes within the boot. The putrid scent began to soak into his clothes as Korra's sock, like a sponge filled with water, began to unload its perspiration onto its captive prey.
Finally, Korra stood to her full height, smother Mako beneath her astronomically immense weight, in between the sweat-drenched fibers of her worn sock and the scruffy fur of her old Water Tribe slipper boot. "All set.", he heard his new goddess boom and felt the seismic tremor caused by her left foot stepping down. He then felt weightless as Korra lifted her right boot. As she took her step, her foot slammed down upon him with unimaginable fury.

"It's gonna a long day.", they both thought to themselves.

1133.content:
Skidding to a halt on the smooth wooden floor of the temple, Mako looks up towards the sound of heavy footfalls. Turning the corner and headed right towards him as Avatar Aang's eldest granddaughter, Jinora. She was garbed in the traditional airbender clothes: Poofy, loose fitting yellow shirt and pants with brown shoes and a small red shawl.

"Hey Jinora! Down on the floor!" Mako cried up to the towering teen, but it was ineffective. Jinora's attention was completely focused on the novel held in her hand. Mako's cries fell on deaf ears.

As Jinora continued down the hallway, Mako realized he was missing out what might be his best chance at salvation. Thinking quickly, he ran out into the path of the brown boots.

"Sorry about this, but you've left me with no choice." Mako took a deep breath, and as the foot descended over his tiny form, he released a blast of fire at her sole. It was a powerful shot, guaranteed to get her attention.

Except, it didn't. All the fire Mako produced dissipated harmlessly against the shoe, and Jinora's step continued unobstructed. Too late, Mako realized how insignificant he truly was. The foot drove into him, smashing him against the floor and knocking him out cold.



Peering over her book, Jinora took a glance at the floor. Her step had ended up on something tiny on the floor, and she wanted to know what it was. Marking her place in the novel and setting it aside, Jinora crouched and took a look. It seemed like a little doll. The doll was extremely tiny, thinner than her tattoo arrows were wide. Picking it up, she noticed a striking resemblance to that firebending boy Korra used to work with... Mako. It was probably a figurine based off of the Fire Ferrets.

Jinora's fist closed over the toy. Her outfit was lacking in pockets, so she'd have to carry it until she found its owner. Was it Korra's? She didn't seem to be one to miss the past, but she did love her pro-bending days. Maybe it was Ikki's. She loved collecting dolls and things, and if it was related to Korra's romance, it was all the more interesting to her. Of course, Jinora really wanted to get back to her book. She could just toss the ridiculous toy to a corner of her room until someone asked her about it.

It wasn't hard for Jinora to find her sister. The day was rather young, and Ikki was not an early riser. Jinora knocked on the door to her room and stood back.

The door slowly swung open, and in front of Jinora stood Ikki, in all of her early morning glory. "I'm sorry," Jinora said. "Were you still sleeping?"

Rubbing the sleep out of her eyes, Ikki replied, "Yeah. *Yawn* What is it?" Ikki was still in her morning wear, dressed in yellow pajamas, with her hair down and feet bare.

Jinora opened her closed hand, revealing the tiny firebender in her palm. "I found this model pro-bender on the floor over there. I was wondering if it was yours?" Ikki leaned in to Mako and squinted, still clearly half asleep.

"I guess. I'll *yawn* take it if you don't want it." Covering her yawn with one hand, she sloppily grabbed for Mako with her other. Still clumsily waking, Ikki's grasp misses and she only manages to send Mako to the floor. With her reflexes slowed by exhaustion, Ikki steps forward to catch the "doll" only after's Mako's already on the floor. Her foot ends up on top of the poor boy.

"Careful, you'll break it."

Ignoring Jinora's concern, Ikki wiggles her toes over the tiny form. "It's warm." She grabs it's head between her toes and begins to roll it around.

"Sorry about that. I've had it in my hand for a while."

"It's alright. Thanks." With that, Ikki kicks her foot back and launches Mako into the room, before shutting the door and jumping back onto the bed.


A while later, Mako finally awakens. Peering about, he discovers:

Jinora slid into her room. She knew the "toy" had to belong to someone, but her book was simply too interesting to put down. Closing her door, she dropped the doll in the corner of her room before excitedly airbending herself to the bed.


Mako woke up feeling slightly clammy. His skin felt like it'd been coated in a layer of cold sweat, and he had a feeling that it wasn't his. Taking in his surroundings, Mako realized he wasn't in the hallway anymore.

The room was sparsely decorated, and the few items adorning the wall were all related to airbending history. There was a small model of Avatar Aang's blue glider, a painted picture of Avatar Yangchen, and a scroll with a quote from some long-dead guru who Mako probably never heard of. And, sitting on her bed with her legs tucked up to her chin was Jinora, still as giant as before.

Wasting no time, Mako ran up to the side of the bed. It towered over him. It would take hours to climb, assuming Mako wouldn't get tired or Jinora wouldn't get up. At the foot of the bed was Jinora's discarded brown boots, standing straight up.

Mako jogged over to them, and a plan started forming in his head. The boots were tall, yes, but not as tall as the bed. He could use firebending to get onto them, and could then easily finish the climb to the top of the bed.

Mako keeled down. His fighting style was up close and personal, and he didn't need to be a rocket very often. He'd only get one shot at this, and he didn't want to muck it up. Firebending comes from the breath; Mako breathed out and blasted the ground.

The little rocketman shot up into the air. The boots rushed past him as he reached incredible heights, before his inevitable fall. Looking down, he saw the unending void that was the boot of a little girl. Screaming in terror, he reached out wildly, trying to grab anything that would halt his fall into shoe-zilla.


This is why Team Avatar never lets Mako come up with plans.
11333.title: Let go of your earthly tether...

113331.content:
Mako's flailing arms couldn't catch anything, and he continued to plummet. Bumping roughly against the sides of the boot, Mako hurdled down into the depths of Jinora's footwear.

His body hits the shoe floor face-first, filling his mouth with stale sweat. Sitting up, Mako spits out the putrid taste and tries to see how screwed he is. Soaked in sweat that wasn't his, trapped in a shoe that was much bigger than him, and no one knew anything about him? Poor Mako was doomed.

Getting to his feet, tiny Mako decides he should look around for an escape route. First and foremost: Can he get out the way he came in?

Mako set his hand against the side of the shoe. Smooth, with no purchase for climbing. And he couldn't just rocket out, since he'd likely set the shoe on fire as he attempted to escape.

Turning about, Mako peered down into the furthest depths of the boot. Lighting a small flame for a light source, Mako peered down the tunnel. At his current size, Mako would have to crawl to go there. It'd leave him vulnerable if Jinora decides to wear the boot, but it might be the only way to get out. Getting on his hands and knees, Mako ventured onward.

The smell only got worse as he went forward. Jinora wasn't a tomboy by any extension of the word, but even her feet would stink after hours of airbending. And these boots were clearly not new; Mako could see the depression caused by her sole. In fact, Mako could see how he ranked in size next to the dark imprint of her sole! If he needed to, he could most likely fit under her arch or between her toes and the ball of her foot, and he would live.

From outside of his new found prison, Mako heard the sound of a temple door sliding open. Soft foot steps padded past the boot, and Mako's heart jumped into his throat.

"Honey, do you mind helping me for a second? Rohan got his kite stuck in a tree, and he can't airbend yet. Could you get it for him?" That voice belonged to Pema, Jinora's kindly mother. "Sure. Just let me mark my place here..."

Mako realized what was going to happen. He turned around and watched the slender foot slide into her shoe. Panicked, Mako shuffled his way to the nearest safe zone, right as the foot overtook his little body.

An airbender steps lightly, like the calm wind on a summer day. This was Mako's salvation, for the weight of Jinora was massive and his body was weak. Yes, her steps hurt him, pressing his body into the unrelenting flesh every time the foot went down, but he shuddered to think of how he'd fare under Asami's feet. Her quick steps would flatten him out in seconds. Or worse, if he was under Korra's foot, he'd be ground to a pulp immediately.

Of course, it wasn't very good down here, either. Jinora was a fourteen year old girl, well on her way through puberty. Mako would almost prefer to be under Ikki's sole; sure, she was spring loaded, but at least she wouldn't be sweating as much. Jinora's foot was practically gushing as she stepped, and each swing of her leg sloshed Mako in it. The foot went up, and Mako was pushed into the insole, marinating in old juices. The foot went down, and Mako was pushed into the actual foot, the source of the bath.

Halfway down the hall, Jinora stopped. She tapped her foot, giving Mako a quick battering. She thinks to herself, If I glide over there, it'll be a whole lot faster than walking...

Padding back to her room, Jinora opens the little closet. In her left hand, she grabbed her Airbending glider; in her right, she had the wingsuit. The glider would be faster, since she wouldn't have to change clothes, but the wingsuit was way more comfortable. Peering at the closed book laying on her bed, she made up her mind.

113332.content:
Mako opens his eyes. He's dangling on the inside of the boot, holding on with his finger tips to the top of the boot's entrance. He sighs, happy he didn't fuck it up.

As he struggles to pull himself up, Mako can't help but get a whiff of the shoe. It wasn't terrible, per se, but it was obvious that a foot spent time in there. Mako was glad he didn't have to spend time with it.

Once he was out of the shoe, it was a simple matter to climb the bedsheets and summit the bed. There, Mako found Jinora. She hadn't bothered to change out of her airbending robes, choosing only to remove her shoes. Engrossed in her book, Jinora sat with her back to the wall, knees tucked under her chin and book only inches from her face.

"Hey Jinora! It's Mako! You know, Korra's friend? I could really use some help here." Not a single iota of recognition crossed her face; her expression still showed her enraptured by her story. Mako was gonna have to get closer.

Right in front of him was Jinora's massive feet. Stepping a little closer, Mako couldn't stop himself from noticing how soft they looked. Experimentally, Mako reached out and touched a toe. In response, all five toes and that foot curled in, away from him. He giggled.

In his head, Mako could hear Chief Beifong's voice scolding him. "Enough lollygagging. Get to work Mako, or I'll be assigning you to toilet duty for the next three years." Mako lit a flame in his palm. He could easily give the girl a little burn, nothing much, to get her attention. But was that the best choice? 1542221.content:
Kuvira couldn't believe that Verrick's spirit vine experiment actually shrunk her! Now she was stuck wandering around her train in secret until either Verrick or Baatar could somehow reverse the process. The last thing she needed was her followers to see her in this sorry state.

Things were going well until the train stopped in Zaofu and a giant burst into her private quarters demanding an audience. Who was it?
1542221.title: Yeah

choices: "...You can beat me in a fight!"
"You beat me in a little {pun intended} challenge."
15422211.content:
The Avatar had made a complete recovery since Kuvira had last seen her and looked more ready for a fight than ever. The formerly great uniter didn't like her odds in her current size so she hid even as Korra called out to her: "Kuvira, where are you!? We need to talk now!" The shrunken dictator had used her metal bending cables to climb to the top of her door and hide but Korra's booming voice startled her and caused her to fall right into the Avatar's grip.

"KUVIRA!? IS THAT YOU!?" Kuvira covered her ears in pain at the booming voce then said "yes. It's a long story but no matter what size I am, you won't stop me! Either join my cause or get out my way!" The shrunken dictator regretted these words the minute she said them.

Korra grinned evily. "Get out of your way huh? Okay then. I'll stay out of your way if..."
